newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian gilt prices steady in moderate trade.
newsitem.headline: Indian gilt prices steady in moderate trade.

text.p: * Indian government security prices were steady in light trade Friday, dealers said.
* They said there were more sellers than buyers in the market but few deals were struck as traders remained cautious ahead of next Wednesday's bond auction.
The Reserve Bank of India auctions 30 billion rupees of three-year central government bonds on May 28.

* "Some players seem keen to sell as they plan to switch over to the new stock but there are few buyers at the moment," said a dealer. "Most market players seem to be waiting for the auction to be over before taking a view on liquidity and taking fresh positions."
* In latest deals, the 12.69 percent 2002 stock traded at 100.35 rupees against its last traded 100.30 and the 13.50 percent 1998 traded at 102.90.
* Treasury bills maturing on April 24 1998 traded at a yield of 9.35 percent against last yield of 9.40 percent.
